website_summaries.verdict: A good value on a bag that performs well and comes in a lot of colors.
pros: Can be used as an airline carry on
Telescoping handle can completely retract into a zippered compartment
Has 8 pockets for easy accessibility and good organization capability
cons: Wheels can be a little wobbly when the bag is very full
Does not stand up very well

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag. I dig it. Larger than it looks.
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently, I am a shorter (5'4'') jeans and t shirt dude. this is great for "week" trips without lots of clothing. this bag has great pockets all around and is surprisingly large inside. made of scrabble material, comfortable to hold. Has an ID card slot on the rear. got wheels, straps and the telescoping luggage handle.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Salvaggio

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, Lasted one trip
customer_reviews.text: The hard plastic material along the bottom of the bag is too flimsy. Even under a moderate load, it bowed out, in between the wheels. As a result, the bottom edge of the bag rubbed along the ground, wearing away the fabric and scuffing the bag badly. The bowing also makes it hard to pull the bag, which is the whole point of having wheels. All of this happened on my first trip. Bottom line: You might think you are getting a bargain, but you're better off investing in a higher-quality bag.
customer_reviews.author: BYY2x2

customer_reviews.title: Work offshore and us it monthly, it takes a ...
customer_reviews.text: Work offshore and us it monthly, it takes a real beating pulling it up and down stairs on boat. holds 16 days worth of cloths all my bedding plus more pack about 78lbs of supplies with no problem added 2 large pieces of cardboard one on each side for more support
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Traveled to Europe with this bag and it didn't even make it through the first leg of the trip. Wheel caved in, fabric torn, made it super hard to drag. Had to carry the bag. I though it would at least make it through ONE trip..bought on May 6 for a June 14 trip and they only give you 30 days to return it!! Extremely disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: KATHY SMALLER

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bag - the layout, ease of handling - for a two week trek through Europe, it was perfect, except one thing. On the second day of travel, the bottom wore off the bag. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Milesgirl

customer_reviews.title: Might as well packed in brown bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for my wife for a trip to Chicago. It didn't pass it's first trip test. The wheels don't roll, and already the handle strap broken with rips developing in the sides. Construction is very poor. Now she is stuck in Chicago with an unusable bag,will have to purchase another bag to get her home.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: This bag will hold a lot of stuff, but apparently will not last long. I have used it for one 19 day trip and the bottom has worn through. It seems that there is a weak spot in front of the wheels on the end of the bag that allows the material to drag on the ground when you are pulling it on the wheels. This spot has completely worn through after this one trip. Also the extendable handle does not lock in the extended position and pushes back in very easily. Pass this one by and spend a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: CaretakerCT

customer_reviews.title: American Airlines refused as carry-on & fell apart during baggage handling.
customer_reviews.text: These had a weird odor - I had to set them outside to air out for a few days ahead of our trip. At the airport, we were told they are too large for American Airlines overhead compartment and were made to check them at the gate, same on the way home - when we retrieved at baggage claim one of them had split open at the seam. I would return, except now it's all dirty from being going through the conveyors at the airport. I'm disappointed because these were advertised as the perfect carry-on...and they aren't.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Rocks!

customer_reviews.title: This bag is a steal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a steal for the price. We have two—a 29” blue one and a 33” green one. In the past two years we’ve taken the blue one to Europe for 4 weeks and 2 weeks in Asia. The green one has gone to Asia for 2 weeks. They’ve held up remarkably well considering the beating they get on international flights and during transfers. No tears in the fabric and all the zippers still work great. We use zip ties to secure the locks and no one has bothered trying to open them yet. They hold a ton and are lightweight, which is a plus! And, no smell (which some others said was an issue).
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very tough
customer_reviews.text: This thing held up for an entire month long trip in east and west Europe. Anything that can handle going up and down stairs in Russia, trains in France, ferries in England, planes in Belarus, and cars in Poland deserves 5 stars. It isn't pretty anymore and the side pokets are pretty much useless but the main bag is still holding my stuff. And I did stuff it it full!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: The bag is huge and it looks just like the picture
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag for my upcoming vacation. The bag is huge and it looks just like the picture. I love this pink. It seems to be made well. We will see after my trap, as it is filled to capacity lol!
customer_reviews.author: LaToya

customer_reviews.title: recommended
customer_reviews.text: we normally use hard cases but the problem is storage. we have a large family of 6 and bought 4 of these. works great. the gray stripes is a good place to mark your last name on with a permanent marker. i wish they came in brighter colors so baggage thieves will avoid them. there is plenty of room that the side pockets were unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: -a|ex

customer_reviews.title: AA carry on no problem
customer_reviews.text: Took a 6 day trip to LA for a friend's wedding. Was able to go from DFW to LAX and back on American Airlines as a carry on. No issues getting it on the plane and fit in the overhead bins great. As long as you don't over pack you'll be good. Treat it nicely and it won't tear/break on you. Definitely satisfied with this purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J Lowe

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 4 broke on my first trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4. They looked great. They had the bad plastic smell when they arrived but I aired them out and used dryer sheets and they seemed ok. They were easy to pack and had so much space. But 3 out of the 4 broke after the first flight. The metal handles cracked or bent so you couldn't pull them all the way our or push them into the bag. It made it a horrible experience trying to fly back home. Dont waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: outstanding duffel bag
customer_reviews.text: A solidly built duffle bag. We own several of these bags and all are ruggedly made. They are easy to lock when traveling. The wheels allow for smooth rolling and the handle feels sturdy. We know this company stands behind their products as we once needed a repair and they took care of it quickly and efficiently. We absolutely will continue to buy from this company.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Its been used for 3 airplane trips and has held up very well. Also been used for some overnights and business travel. No complaints. Will it hold up to weekly business flights or use by a flight crew? Probably not. But for the occasional traveler, its worked fine. Priced right, pretty well built, decent zippers and straps. The handle is firm and stable and the wheels are like those used on rollerblades. Would buy again and recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it is a great bag. It just doesn't hold up well, with the airline handlers.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great bag, light-weight, and the pink bag I bought was easy to spot. However, it really only made one trip flying. I flew from PHX to HEL (Finland). They actually lost my bag. (I am assuming it was in Chicago where I connected.) I did get the bag 1 day later. It looked terrible and the plastic had broken down, and it did not roll well. I was going to throw it out, but I decided to keep it for camping/ Four-wheeling trips. It is lightweight, so it did hold a lot of clothes for my trip, without being overweight. I actually would buy it again for the price.
customer_reviews.author: GoodLifeOfFood

customer_reviews.title: One of the wheels collapsed during it's first use! ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the wheels collapsed during it's first use! Only took about 5 mins. Unfortunately we are still traveling with it so I can't replace it or return it yet. Hoping they will take it back for a full refund as soon as we get home.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for a small child's vacation trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old to use on a three-week vacation trip. It's not the most elegant suitcase out there but it held all her clothes and toys with room to spare, was pretty easy for her to roll through airports (although I've read in other reviews that it doesn't stand up on its own, we didn't have that problem) and the purple color made it easy to spot on conveyor belts. It's also easy to shove into the trunk of a rental car because it's soft-sided. I also appreciated the fact that I didn't have to worry about damaging it. It seems pretty tough and at the price, did an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Lheaven

customer_reviews.title: Entire bottom torn open - clothes falling out at baggage claim
customer_reviews.text: I had this for under 1 year. I have used it no more than 4 times. The most recent being the only time I have ever flown with the bag (versus a trip I drove to). I found it with the Entire bottom torn open - all my clothes falling out at baggage claim. There was never even a thread giving out - it was totally unexpected & awful!
customer_reviews.author: Bella J. H. ♡

customer_reviews.title: This bag is a steal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a steal for the price. We have two—a 29” blue one and a 33” green one. In the past two years we’ve taken the blue one to Europe for 4 weeks and 2 weeks in Asia. The green one has gone to Asia for 2 weeks. They’ve held up remarkably well considering the beating they get on international flights and during transfers. No tears in the fabric and all the zippers still work great. We use zip ties to secure the locks and no one has bothered trying to open them yet. They hold a ton and are lightweight, which is a plus! And, no smell (which some others said was an issue).
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Hangs in there
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the actual case is really good. The only issue I've had since it was bought back in August of 2013 is that the stitching for the velcro on the handle loop began to separate after about 6 uses (Nothing epoxy and heavy duty thread together along the seam couldn't correct). Still going strong even 2.5 years later for both international and domestic trips.
customer_reviews.author: InuKun

customer_reviews.title: Has stood up to good use.
customer_reviews.text: A suitcase is not the sort of product to be reviewed immediately. I've had this one for almost a year now, putting it to good use in a number of travels. I've found it to be lightweight but sturdy, durable, and very roomy. The only word of caution is that if you aren't careful, you can pack this thing beyond the usual boundaries of carry-on luggage. I haven't had any serious problems yet, but there have been close calls.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac S.

customer_reviews.title: Wheels Cannot handle 50 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about getting this product. Unfortunately it’s barely made it home from our trip. The wheel is bent on it because it could not support the weight that the bag is supposed to hold. The company was nice and return the product with no problems and refunded me the money. However had the trip been Any longer I would’ve been stuck with serious luggage issues abroad. Probably a good bag for things that are under 30 pounds. We maxed at 50 and it couldn’t handle it
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice little bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag because my husband and I are going to Amsterdam and we needed a bag quick. I searched all over and I wanted something with pockets and I could store a lot since we were only taking carry on bags. I saw this and I was kind of unsure because of reviews but when I received the item I was really happy. I purchased this bag in the color purple and it is a nice shade. Comes with pockets and is a soft bag. It doesn't have 4 spinner wheels, but it's great. I can't wait to use it because it seems pretty durable!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first flight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a few days before I went on vacation. I was so excited to use it, as I had no other suitcase alternative. However, I got the duffel bag back from the airline and the handle was completely broken! I expected it to last a bit longer than that. It was so tiring to wheel it around without a handle, so much so that I bought myself a new suitcase while on vacation to return with, and did away with the original one. I hope the company will compensate me for the loss, as it happened days after I had purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit as a carry on with United Airlines
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for carry on on exclusively and it did not fit in United Airline carry on sizing parameters. I was stopped by the agent at boarding and he checked my bag and I had to go to baggage claim to get it. Do not buy this bag as a carry on.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Be More Happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This duffle bag is great for travel!!!! I had bought a smaller version of this, and just had to get it!!!! The durability is great!!! I have taken this on my last 5 trips out of town, and it held up to the rigorous handling of travel. The wheels ride smooth, and they are far enough apart so that there is not "bouncing" back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Cooley Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for a Long Trip
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these large bags. This was terrific for traveling 4.5 weeks throughout Europe with a number of on/off's. The bags were fabulous for continuous packing, unpacking and repacking. Handled the bumps and perils of travel. Given the price we figured the material would not be a great as the design and we were correct. The material is showing considerable wear and if unrealistic, then don't buy. But if you're like use and knew what you are buying for a terrific trip of a lifetime and are ok with a bag as tired as the travelers, the this is a great deal - it was for us and we'd do it again, with these bags.
customer_reviews.author: NJP

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the low cost
customer_reviews.text: I am a chronic over-packer when I travel. I ordered this duffel while on vacation because, on the flight out, I over-packed my luggage past the weight limits, and didn't want to schlep through the airport on the way home with a bunch of extra stuff. Very decent duffel for the price! Roller wheels are good. Zippers work and stayed fastened. The only thing is that I ordered the pink color and, after one flight, it's already scuffed and dirty. So... if I had it to do over, I'd buy one of the darker colors to mask the dirty airport marks. Otherwise, this bag got the rest of my stuff home safely and securely.
customer_reviews.author: JCo

customer_reviews.title: Awful chemical smell. Website doesn't mention Prop 65 warning (and I'm pregnant)...
customer_reviews.text: The first thing you'll notice when you open the box is the awful chemical smell. The website should clearly mention the Proposition 65 warning that is attached to the suitcase! Don't wait for me to buy it and find out! Businesses subject to Proposition 65 are required to provide a warning if they cause exposures to chemicals listed as causing birth defects or reproductive harm. Great, I'm pregnant and this could cause birth defects. On top of that, the suitcase is really flimsy, not suited for heavy duty travel. I'd rather spend a little more money for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: KimchiTeacher#1

customer_reviews.title: Great and solid construction only minor gripes
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy, easily fit a week of thermal layered clothing, easy to get through TSA, fits most master locks on the loops on the zipper pull tabs . the several pockets fit everyday nick knacks like Razors an tooth brushes comfortably that you may need for long week away, also kept a few cold items for transport and notice while they didn't stay cold, they get notably warm after several hours in tight space in plane/going through the bagging process. Rolling around was smooth and comfortable on airport and office style carpeting, as well as hardwood/marble/linoleum flooring or most flat sidewalks. Easy to clean off with a spray bottle and a rag/paper towel or with a wet wipe
customer_reviews.author: I Kisala

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed, inexpensive bag
customer_reviews.text: This rolling duffel is inexpensive, and you get what you pay for. There are several design flaws with this bag. It does not have cinch straps, so if you are packing it to less than capacity, there's no way to prevent everything from rolling around. There's something off with the wheels - it repeatedly tips over to either side when being pulled. And you cannot stand it on end and let go of the handle without it toppling over.
customer_reviews.author: K. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Big luggage
customer_reviews.text: We took the luggage on a trip for 2 weeks. It did well without any problems rolling the items everywhere. It seems sturdy and tough enough for kids and adults who pack other items besides clothing. The olive green is a good sporty color for older boys and men with plenty of pocket and clothing space. I like it with all that open storage area. I'd buy one myself when I need a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Split WIDE OPEN under very light use. **Avoid**
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in concept and layout but split WIDE OPEN at the beginning of a trip. Note: the duffle was not over stuffed or stressed in any way. The luggage was used lightly. I attempted to return the defective unit but it was past the remarkably short return period.While I wanted to like this unit with it's 6 external pockets and large capacity central space it literally fell apart when I needed it most. Sorry I suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: N. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this duffle bag as a checked in luggage on a flight and it was a success. Easy to carry around the airport, big enough to fit a lot of things but not so big that it becomes too heavy to be lifted. The bright color makes it easy to spot on the luggage carousel.
customer_reviews.author: Telma Micheloto

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bag for work purposes, not really traveling (buses, ships, planes and trains), so I can't really give my opinion based on traveling. I can say, I like the size (29") and all the pockets. There's more than enough pockets, which I'm a huge fan of the saying, "it's better to have and not need, than to need and not have". The all around sturdiness seems okay, the zippers moves smooth, straps seems legit, but I've been wheeling it more than carrying it, which is great for me. I would recommend this bag to others. I gave it 4 stars because it's not as bright red as I thought it would be, based off the advertised picture displayed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to pick this bag.....I have a massive Patagonia rolling 'duffel' that I compare everything to and it's just not fair to the others...the Patagonia is amazing! But I just needed something simple and not as hard core for my son to go back and forth from home in NJ to college in Denver. So far (two trips) it's been great. Fits a ton!!! Rolls nicely. It DOES tip when you try to stand it up and it's not the best quality in the world (the inside straps and lining are cheapo) but for this price, I'm so far pleased with the duffel. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: coyofamily

customer_reviews.title: Okay bag, not the best for airline travel
customer_reviews.text: This bag really took a beating on my recent weeklong vacation. I could definitely tell that the airlines had some fault but the quality of the bag definitely didn't help either. It's a nice large bag but don't expect it to last long. I needed something to travel with that would fit some of my prop weapons and this did the trick. If you don't mind spending the money and only using this bag once or twice via airline it should be fine. This bag would last much longer if it were being used for car/train trips only.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!
customer_reviews.text: There are some reviews that talk about it's not standing when packed but I found if you place your heavy, larger items on the bottom, packing it with it standing in mind, I have no problem with that. The zippers all work well but a bit sticky unless you hold the tabs designed for that purpose they work fine. This bag was in the bed of a truck, in the rain and snow overnight and all the items remained dry. It holds up to being put in and out of the bed with no rips or tears.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Bequette

customer_reviews.title: The Smell, oh the horrendous and strong Odor!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this bag and I like it a lot. It's large, the zippers seem good and solid, the handle is long enough and the wheels work. So why only 4 stars? The thing REEKS with an odor that is similar to maybe oily plastic on a hot highway. I mean it is BAD and very strong, Even the box it came in stinks. It's been Febrezed and sitting in the sun for 4 hours. Can't say it's any better yet. I travel in 4 days. Hoping it airs out before then! If anyone has any ideas on how to eliminate this smell, I'd be grateful.
customer_reviews.author: tinco123

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to camp with tween, airports, and everything in between!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has anted the heck out of this bag for the last 4 years. Several plane trips, every camping trip, sleepover, trip to summer camp, etc. We finally have to retire it because she bent the handle. Even after taking the handle out it made 2 more trips before the inconvenience of not being able to roll it became too much. If it had 4 wheels, I'd be in luggage heaven! This 26"bag holds more stuff than our adult 33" suitcase that routinely gets overweight. Luckily our daughter's bag can always take a few more items to get everything under weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I read some good and bad reviews on this bag and decided to purchase for a flight to Mexico. First of all don’t buy this bag if you have to go to an airport at all. Just believe me, and do not put yourself through the torture. It doesn’t want to roll properly. It flips over A LOT, won’t stand up, it’s just annoying overall. Well made? Not really. It will hold a good amount of stuff but I personally don’t think it’s worth the headache. I’m going to throw it in the trash because if I donate it I am subjecting someone else to that same headache.
customer_reviews.author: miranda pinkley

customer_reviews.title: lots of storage but handle broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter for our family vacation. She loved it. It has lots of pockets and plenty of space in the main compartment. Got to the airport and the telescopic handle broke. It wouldn't extend and one side came off completely. Unfortunately, I'm past the return date so, now were stuck with a broken suitcase. If the handle hadn't broken I would have given this duffel 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: disney lover

customer_reviews.title: Not The Greatest
customer_reviews.text: The main space inside is large enough to hold a carry-on's worth of clothes & toiletries, but the pockets are quite small and don't hold very much at all. The handle comes out easily and it rolls nicely, but it is extremely top-heavy and won't stand up by itself no matter how I try to make sure my items are evenly distributed. It also came with a VERY nasty chemical plastic smell that transferred to my clothes. I had to use deodorizers and let it air out for two weeks before using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very roomie with additional pockets on the outside and one on the front. They are not huge but when using as your only carry luggage for the airline you would not want them any larger. I took this with me to Europe for 2 weeks. I love it! I did not lack for any space for clothes, jacket, shoes etc. The bag held up well too. I would highly recommend this product. I ordered the black with Chevron trim. I did not have any problems with the bag smelling badly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an emergency Go bag
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed for an emergency earthquake/fire go bag. A 22” wheeled duffel with lots of outside pockets where I could stash various things like first aid and sanitation, and plenty of interior space for emergency clothing, comfort, cooking kit, etc. It’s super cheap and I don’t know how well it would stand up to a lot of manhandling and rolling it around on a vacation, which is why I knocked it down a star, but if you just need a red rolling duffel bag in the event of an emergency, this thing is perfect for two people. And honestly how can you go wrong for $24?!
customer_reviews.author: T. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag
customer_reviews.text: Really nice & roomy. This bag exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend it. It will be big enough for both of our clothing & personals. Photo attached for size comparison
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Coil

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these bags have been great for us. Never checked them on an airline, but for vacation, they pack great in the car and hold more clothes than you'd expect for a 22in bag. I like that the entire top zips open to easily stack folded clothes. The rolling wheels are handy, but certainly not all terrain. One of them had a strong plastic smell so I left it in the sun and it quickly dissipated. No complaints for under 30$ they've held up fine after multiple uses. We have 3 of them.
customer_reviews.author: twoyearold

customer_reviews.title: A TON of room for stuff
customer_reviews.text: I give this bag 5 stars because of the roominess. For a 10 day trip (no flight travel), I was able to pack everything I needed plus options, which is a huge hit for me. I like that there is a zippered liner at the bottom of the main area - under the liner is where I packed shoes. The side pockets are a plus for electronics accessories and other smaller items. Doesn't stand on it's on too well, but not a big deal for me. Not sure about the durability, only one use so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did a good job.  Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I"m not sure I'm a fan of the softness. I didn't carry on, I checked the bag at the desk. It held up really well all things considered although I got locks for the zippers since I was concerned that all the bumping around would pull them open by accident. That seems not to have happened on the ones I didn't lock so all was good. Things people have said are the issues with this suitcase. It doesn't stand upright when you have the handle pulled out and everything slides to the bottom. That said I was happy with the suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: The KING of a CARRY ON that has so many External Pockets for easy Access
customer_reviews.text: I love this AirLine approved Carry on. The price was a BARGAIN. Its made of heaven Balistic Material. Wheels and Handle are great for wheeling through the airports to and from the car. Its amazing how much it holds and it haspockest on both sides and one on the end on the exterior and 2 on the Top of the Case. Its amazing how much extra functionality these give the product. My spouse thought it was over kill until he saw how it worked on our last trip out west. He now has a RED one! BUY ONE!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I am a person who relies on reviews before making a purchase...this product has mixed reviews but I figured for the price, I’d chance it. Needless to say, it was a great gamble. It easily held 3 days worth of clothes for myself, wife and son, along with different items. The extra pockets were awesome too!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Overall, pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Florida, and it worked out pretty well. It's not always easy to keep directed in the right direction when you pull it, but you learn pretty quickly what the trick is. It certainly holds a ton of clothing. I didn't try to use it as a carry on, because I think it's really too big for that. But it was great for stowed luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Walter F. Thiessen

customer_reviews.title: Did the job but smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little smaller than I expected. It’s ok thus far. Stood up on its on without falling over. Lots of pockets. Will update once I get a good use out of it. Ps I wanted something that I can hand carry and folds out a little fuller to check in on the way back. It’ll do for this trip. Will report back. If I can I’ll give it at 4.5 just due to the smaller than expected size. Rolled nicely. I was pushing a stroller with one hand and pulling this along with the other - along with another bag on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: VPBermuda

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot, but easily gets off balance which is a pain when traveling in a hurry. I'll usually use it for about a week's worth of travel (when I know there isn't any laundry available). Also, it was my fault for purchasing a cloth bag, but I would recommend going hard shell. At one point, I had checked this bag in, but we had to switch planes right before boarding. Our bags were left out in the freezing rain for some amount of time, and when I picked up my bag, all of my clothes/belongings were completely soaked through besides what I had put in waterproof bags.
customer_reviews.author: QQ

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for a trip and it was great. The only hiccup was shipping was later than it was supposed to be but it has been an extremely busy time. It packed well and the zippering worked well. Important for me. Thought I ordered the hot pink but red was the one for the price. Still a great color. The wheels and handle are definitely worth it. And it was nice and roomy. Was able to pack clothes and gifts without having any problems. Great product and price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Performed as well as possible-met expectations
customer_reviews.text: We purchased three of these, in different colors. Used them on vacation. We traveled by car, so no flying involved. They performed as a duffel would. The thing that I couldn't get over was the smell. Like mothballs. So bad, I had to unpack immediately and set them out on our lanai to air out the entire trip. I even put dryer sheets in them to help kill the smell. I do have an oversensitive nose though and no body else mentioned the smell. I'm not sure how well they would hold up by being thrown into cargo on a plane, but for our trip, they were just fine and we needed soft and squishy to fit in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Its trash after one trip - Missed the return window by two days
customer_reviews.text: The bag was large and had good zippers that held out. Sadly that the only thing that did. The fabric is torn and the seams are tearing. Its bad enough that I would not risk checking it again at an airline counter for fear that they would refuse it due to the appearance.
customer_reviews.author: james mandelbaum

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size, mobility and all the pockets for storage. However I would caution anyone who wants to use it as a carry-on bag. For one flight that we had, we didn't have any issues carrying it on, however on the trip back, we were told we had to check them. It's expandable, which normally is a good thing, so you just really have to be careful with how much you put into it to avoid being denied when attempting to use it as a carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Spurfan

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy when transporting a full bag
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy when transporting a full bag. The section in-between the 2 wheels drags on the ground after one use. I was able to make only one trip with this bag and then got rid of it. It was a waste of money. I have bought Olympia luggage for 15-20 years. It was always sturdy and dependable - even after several overseas trips. But, I don't find that quality in their luggage anymore.
customer_reviews.author: HOPE

customer_reviews.title: GREAT purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in a panic a week before a trip to Washington state when I realized my luggage zippers were broken. Absolutely LOVE this bag!! It was big enough to pack my hiking boots and several pairs of shoes along with everything I needed for a week, including a backpack. However it is not so big that it is a pain to lug around. The wheels and handle made it amazing through the airport. Lots of pockets on every side.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this bag
customer_reviews.text: Please don't not buy this bag the wheels on the bags are no good this is the second bag I have got from them and both of them did the same thing the plastic on one of wheels started to pill then the bag in uneven and very hard to pull i have only had this bag about a month if that long ond the bags is not cheep I fell like I was cheated out of my money I would never buy anything from this company again I put these pic up to show u how the wheels look
customer_reviews.author: leora robinson

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, it has been absolutely amazing for about ten trips but with all the travel it has gotten pretty shredded up on the bottom, still useable but it just doesn't look as good anymore. I wish I could give it 4.5 stars. The storage is great and you can actually fit about a week and a half to two weeks worth of clothes (if you are a good packer). If you are looking for an affordable bag, that is small, light and relatively sturdy I would for sure suggest this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a Christmas gift to a sibling who travels a lot, and so far she says she loves it! It is the perfect size for the overhead compartment of all US flights, and so far all of the international flights she has taken as well. She says it expands nicely and wheels roll smoothly. Her only complaint is that it falls over when left alone, but she says that's just because the distribution of weight from the handle to your actual items makes it virtually impossible for it to not tip. She simply lays it flat when sitting and it's not a problem at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe all the negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! I almost passed up on it due to other negative reviews. I’m not sure what others used their bag for but mine did great on a week-long trip to the Bahamas. It got a little scuffed but did not fall apart and still looks great. The handle for the wheels was super useful and my bag was able to stand when full. I bought it when the red option was under $40, which was a steal. Definitely a good bag for regular travel.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Grant-Kinnear

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This duffel is a little bigger than I expected. That is both a plus and a minus. Its size allowed for avoidance of over-packing and putting excessive strain on the zippers, but also enabled me to pack more than I should have. When packed full the duffel obviously tends to be heavier and is more difficult to wheel around. All in all, however, I found this duffel to be of sufficient quality, roomy, and a good value for the price. I would buy it again and recommend it to others, at least to those who don't need to cram it so full as to make it too heavy to handle and put too much strain on the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this bag
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bag! It is large and fits a LOT of clothing, especially compared to a regular/large suitcase. I've used it for sporting activities, packing sports gear, including placing a rolled up sleeping bag inside. Recently, I used it on a ski trip and put all of our family ski gear inside of it. It made it through the flight and kept things dry despite snow and rain. Side pockets are nice too. I'm buying 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: Mauck

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Bought 2 for my boys for an upcoming trip- I was surprised when they showed up by how big they are! They will easily hold all their clothes, a life jacket and even some small toys for our upcoming 8 day trip! The handle folds up/down easily and has a zipper closure to tuck it away when not needed. The wheels roll nicely. The only thing I wasn’t too thrilled about what the smell... they definitely have a stink to them that I’m hoping will go away after some time out of their packaging. Another thing I wish they had was straps to carry like a backpack- but again, for the price these are great!!
customer_reviews.author: N&MKelsey

customer_reviews.title: Bag Definitely Not For Air Travel
customer_reviews.text: I do not suggest this product for airline travel. I purposely purchased this for travel to Maui, it didn't make it all the way without a variety of damage. I had holes, rips, and I can go on and on, but I will spare you the details. More importantly, this duffle bag comes with wheels and a hide-away handle, but the handle can't support , in my case, 58 pounds. You can feel the pressure on the handle and it will eventually break.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Not US Airline Carry-on Size
customer_reviews.text: I quickly read a few reviews which said it was carryon size, and ordered it. But it seemed big when I received it. Then I checked airline sizes and most allow 12”x9”x22” and this is clearly too big by 3” in one dimension. Will keep it for car travel but wouldn't trust being allowed to carry it on board. The green is a nice value but don't understand why some colors are so much more money. Hate pricing games.
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again. Poor return policy.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and I like the material, but it flops over at the top of the bag when it's in standing position. It leans forward, making the entire bag fall forward. It also wobbles from side to side way too much. I didn't feel safe while crossing the street as it kept tipping over. It also almost made me trip a time or two. To make it worse, I've gotta pay $9.12 just to return it?! No thanks. I'll sell it on eBay, or something. Maybe see if a friend wants to buy it. What a hassle. I will not buy this bag again.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality..gave it as a gift to a travel companion. However..she had an issue when she used it on a recent trip. She almost had to check it due to it being too large. Thankfully she had a nice lady at the airport that told her to "stuff it into the box" they use to see if luggage qualifies for carry on. Won't use it again for carry on because she may not get that lucky next time. Kind of disappointed being I bought this gift for that purpose. But overall nice quality product...just don't bring it to the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke at one trip
customer_reviews.text: The bag did well in having lots of room and good pockets for separate storage. But unfortunately, after retrieving it from baggage carousel at the airport, the handle used for wheeling it was totally jammed and unfixable. therefore making it very hard to roll though airport. I feel that I spent this amount for a one time trip and the bag was not extremely heavy. This is poor quality handle and I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke during trip and had to buy another new suitcase!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this new suitcase for a much needed vacation with my kids. I’m a single mom and splurging for a new suitcase was a big deal. Well, I had to splurge for TWO new suitcases because I had to buy another one on my trip because this one BROKE!! The screw from the handle came off and you either had to carry it like a duffel bag or bend down to attempt to roll it by the cloth handle (the extendable handle is what broke) none of which worked for my back. I was sad and disappointed for the waste of money, energy, and time.
customer_reviews.author: Denice C. Slater

customer_reviews.title: Poor Designed roller/stand -- Drags when fully loaded
customer_reviews.text: It only took 2 short trips (5 days each) to make this duffle bag trash. My previous bag from Costco lasted 4 years and hundreds of days on the road. Save your money. The bag is nice to have the external pockets and easy to access u shaped zipper top.....But that is where the "nice" ends. This bag is not designed with a solid bottom piece to prevent the internal contents from causing the bag to scrape/drag when being towed. I even tried to only load 1/2 of the volume of the bag and it still catches on door trim, hotel rugs, and elevators. Save your money until it is redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: James Holsinger

customer_reviews.title: Can't get rid of the smell
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it might be a good bag. I would not know as I was not able to use the bag. Purchased 2/25/19 and one month later, still smells. Had it out in the sun for 2 days. Have tried fabric spray. Have used dryer sheets inside the bag to get rid of the smell. Feel free to send me your "get rid of the smell" ideas. I had to purchase a different bag for a trip. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: CJDates

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband for his international travels. He needed something on wheels, that could fit in the overhead of an airplane, and could fit enough for extended stays overseas. This item fits the bill.......and at a very good price, too. The material is synthetic and not-so-impressive, but for 30-some dollars, what do you expect. The zippers work just fine and, for my husband's needs, the functionality of this duffel suits him just fine. It seems to hold a lot of stuff and the outside compartments are what he needed for easy access to some specific items. The duffel also stands up without falling over when filled or not, which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this bag in July 2016 to help with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag in July 2016 to help with a move I was making overseas. It is obviously very spacious and seemed well made. Overall the suitcase has served its purpose for the price I paid but just something to note, the bag is now unusable after only 3 transatlantic roundtrips. The whole seem that holds the bottom together has come undone. Also, even though this bag is huge, you can maybe get it 3/4 full before you’re likely to be over the airline weight limits so the extra space becomes pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Karon Deatherage

customer_reviews.title: Ripped first time i used it
customer_reviews.text: If i could give this bag 0 stars i would. My first time using this bag, i flew to Europe and it ripped to the point that its not usable. I'm lucky none of my belonging were lost. I had to buy a new bag abroad just to bring my clothes back. If you want an overpriced disposable bag that will rip the first time you use it, this bag if for you! No options to get a refund either....
customer_reviews.author: Adis Ibranovic

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag But Thin Bottom
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for a trip to CO. I really like this bag---Great color (Hot Pink) This size is great and held all of my packing cubes. (I think it's 31 inches) It rolls well. All in all it held up very well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is on the inside, the bottom is not reinforced in any way-----just the thin lining over the outside frame. I took the box it came in, cut a piece of cardboard to fit, laid it in the bottom and it firmed it up nicely. No problems!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Fourroux

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Dance Competition Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for dance competitions. In the pictures I have a fold up clothing rack (it's amazing, and you can but it in Amazon!) A kaboodle, emergency kit, hair kit, food, 4 costumes in their bags, and a steamer. There is TONS more space! I didn't really need the 33" bag, but in order to fit my clothing rack, this size was the best. I love having all of the dance things in one rolling bag, so I don't look like a bag lady walking into competitions! This bag was 1/6th the price of a rack n roll type bag, plus we can use it for other occasions than just dance.
customer_reviews.author: J.Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Not a 4⭐️ Bag
customer_reviews.text: Durability is Pretty much what you would expect for this price , the extendable handle is light duty for a bag this size and feels like it may bend and break when it is full. , the zippers are continuously getting jammed up on the material around it , the bottom edge close to the wheels drags and wears out quickly. I wouldn’t recommend too many trips from long term parking at the airport curbs are a bag killer. However if you are getting curbside pickup it will last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: George W

customer_reviews.title: Where Has This Been?!
customer_reviews.text: This carry on is AWESOME. It fits SO MUCH. I was nervous about buying this because some reviews said it fell apart. I’ve taken it on three trips now and the quality is still great. Word to the wise, I bought this in bright pink, and after one flight it was very noticeably dirty. That kind of thing doesn’t bother me, but if you’d be bothered by it I’d suggest a darker color. I’m so glad I made this purchase. For the price, you really can’t get a better item.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Heath

customer_reviews.title: Not a good Pocket Rolling Buffel
customer_reviews.text: I want to return them but can not find out how to return them. On the first airplane ride, the handle that was connected to the bottom of the bag, wheels was ripped off. There was not much support when inspected. It was very disappointing to have this happened in the first three days of ownership. On the second duffle bag, three of the zipper pouch, zippers fell of in transportation in the first four days of our trip. Even thought the duffle bags looks great, that is about all I can say about the item. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: pat  bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: These are not durable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my 10 year old son, for our vacation to the Caribbean. Now, I would not expect an item like this to last forever, but I would expect it to survive the first trip. When we retrieved the item in the Caribbean, only the first half of the trip, the inside of the bag was ripped. His bag wasn't even max capacity, slightly over half full. I was super sad. I would only purchase this item for small travel around town or car trips. It apparently is not capable of airline abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great value. Vibrant colors, bought 2 for daughter and myself, the canvas is very thick and sturdy. Handle pulls out and it rolls, zips easy, holds a lot. A took away one star because when in the rolling/standing position it did want to tip over but I'm sure how it's packed would make a difference with all the pockets. I would recommend this bag for overnight or weekend travel.
customer_reviews.author: Rukind

customer_reviews.title: For $30 this bag is killer
customer_reviews.text: Went on a 10 day vacation and this bag was perfect, with some room to spare. It's not super duty heavy duty but i've had no problems with it, and I have the smaller size that I take with me every week with minimal wear. The 26" is definitely not carry on size, must be checked. It does not smell, and for people asking if it'll stand up on its own, depends on how you pack it. Sometimes yes, sometimes it would fall over. Rolling duffels are by far the way to go they never fill up and always have room for more. Great bag for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tore at a seam
customer_reviews.text: The bag tore at a seam on the handle end, making a gap of about 4 inches where things could fall out or jump in. I guess this came from carrying it by the handle where the aisle was too narrow to pull it on its wheels. The bag only weighed about 42 pounds with its contents, well below the 50 pound limit that airlines have. Unfortunately I was traveling and the 30-day return period expired while I was out of town so now I'm stuck with it. The photo shows my hand sticking out of the tear.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Pink Bag!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the bag as a gift for a foster child that we sponsored at Christmas. I hope she likes it. It’s really cute and appears to be well-made. Apparently when foster children are moved from home to home, they have to bring what little belongings they have in a garbage bag. A GARBAGE BAG! I hope this pretty pink bag will help the little Girl realize that she is important.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Powers

customer_reviews.title: ... trip to Africa and since it was such a great price I was worried about the trip
customer_reviews.text: I took this on my trip to Africa and since it was such a great price I was worried about the trip. It held up great! I could certainly recommend this light duffel with 6 pockets and so sturdy! I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Lasted long enough for a 3 week trip through Asia.  Wheels suck!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for the sole purpose to use on a 3 week trip through Thailand, Kuala Lumpur and Singapore and it just lasted long enough that I tossed the bag out when I returned. The bag material is study and can take a beating but the wheels SUCK and will break easier than I expected. If you want to purchase a bag to last a long time, look elsewhere. This bag is a good throw-away bag and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: I travel a lot and this is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher in Hawaii, so I travel a LOT. I go to the mainland several times a year for conferences, trainings, and to visit family, so I need something that will hold all of my stuff without being to heavy. This bag is small enough for interisland trips, but also big enough for a 1-2 week stay (packed smartly) to visit family or go to a conference. I LOVE this bag. We will probably get another one, because my boyfriend keeps stealing it for his work trips!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rae

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Very Poor Quality -- Fell apart on first (very short trip)
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed. For the price I didn't expect a product that would last ten years, but it fell apart during it's first trip (a short trip from Dallas to Chicago) and is completely unusable. And for the record, it was not overpacked or abused. I simply had clothes, makeup, shoes, etc. in the bag. COMPLETELY FELL APART. Wheels separated. Was a royal pain in the rear to even get it home.
customer_reviews.author: JulieWehmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and good looking when its not broken
customer_reviews.text: To he honest i actually liked the bag and how it has lots of compartment plus the big one but my problem is after 1 week of using it. It broke on me and thats so quick for a bag like this so i decided to replace it and gave it another shot but the 2nd one is almost the same already so i am thinking of just refunding the 2nd one and already bought another bag and i am happy with the other one i bought.
customer_reviews.author: Maynard

customer_reviews.title: For the price the Quality level is just fine. It did not fall apart after 2 trips
customer_reviews.text: My wife got tired of Carrying her luggage all the time but wanted the convenience of a duffle bag. This thing Is HUGE and she loves it. For the price the Quality level is just fine. It did not fall apart after 2 trips, so we are happy. If you are expecting some heavy duty, double stitched canvas type bag...then prepare to spend more then $40 dollars. This bag, for its size and price point, quality is right on track.
customer_reviews.author: General George Patton

customer_reviews.title: Unstable but HUGE space
customer_reviews.text: I noticed immediately how unstable it is when you go over the slightest bump or uneven surface it will wobble back and forth uncontrollably. There is no running through an airport with this. Other than that huge downside, it can hold a LOT for how small it is. I packed just enough for a 1 week trip. Looking back I would probably go with something that has a little more high quality wheels and a more stable base as this one seems to be too flimsy. You must walk slowly with it.
customer_reviews.author: Akhi

customer_reviews.title: So much room!
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a trip to Australia. This bag held SO much. I had it packed to the seams and right at 50lbs and it held up well and was easy to drag around the airport. Only issue is the Inside seam where zipped separated in one section. Perhaps from being so full. Otherwise the outside and everything else held up great. I know they get thrown around a lot so I'm very happy for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie Mummy

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for carrying an infant scale
customer_reviews.text: I am a lactation consultant in private practice and needed a really great, durable bag to carry my infant scale, pumps, binder, and lots of random small bits and things like gloves, tubing, shields, flanges, etc. This bag is perfect for this purpose. I will say that I think it is about 2" smaller INSIDE the main compartment than the listed dimensions - but accurate if you're measuring the outside.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great bag with plenty of storage
customer_reviews.text: The cost of this bag for the size was perfect for what I needed. I had a slightly larger one from a different manufacturer and it only lasted 6 months. So far this bag has done what I needed it to do. I guess I will return in 6 months to see if it still meets my expectations. But for now. I give it 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: cockydutch

product_meta.title: Olympia 8 Pocket Rolling Duffel Bag, Black/Red, 22 inch
product_meta.description: Size:22 inch| Color:Black/RedThis rolling duffel is constructed of Supreme "PROTECFLON" Polyester with 1200 D. Poly. Recessed metal ball bearing in-line skate wheels. Hide-away retractable handle. A total of 8 convenient pockets allow for maximum packing versatility and makes a perfect travel or school dufflel
feature_bullets: Recessed metal ball bearing in-line skate wheels
Hideaway retractable handle with zipper closure. Self-repairing zippers, Weighs 5.1 pounds
Self-repairing zippers and U-top opening to roomy main compartment; Capacity:3200 cubic. inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,549 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
